Reviews.Title: “Yeah, its a motel”
Reviews.Author: m m
Reviews.Content: Interesting stuff happening in this part of town, plus this was one of the cheapest rooms we could find, and reasonably well located. Lots of action and strange people in and around the building at all hours. My friends' rooms were not all in amazing condition, but I was in one of the "renovated" rooms on the 2nd floor of the north unit, which was perfectly clean (no bedbugs) and well maintained. Very spare amenity. BYOShampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Love It”
Reviews.Author: Lia W
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for years.The location is excellent and the price is right.The staff are always freindly and polite.the only thing I would recommend would be free wifi for the regulars.

Reviews.Title: “Recomended to all travellers to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: maidofthesea
Reviews.Content: I am an out of towner and have stayed at this hotel more than I can count, and would tell you it's clean, neat economical, and simple in the centre of Vancouver, cancal a cab easily, can take the bus easily, and each every night that I have spend there was fantastic, staffs were freindly, easy to talk to, beds were clean, comfortable, enough parking, and the place is absolutely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days and have to say I am very satisfied. Cheap place for Vancouver, but close to Downtown and just next to the vibrant Main streel scene. Stuff is competent and helpful. And great morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: mod s
Reviews.Content: The price was good and the room was decent. The room I stayed in didn't have some of the things I usually expect in a motel like a mini fridge, coffee maker and individual sized jars of shampoo. The TV was out of a museum but I really didn't go to Vancouver to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Got my money's worth”
Reviews.Author: ClydeandJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days for less then 75 a night at the height of tourist season. public transit was close and great . Staff was so friendly. Room was clean. Old place but you get your money's worth for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs in Hotel rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: Came into Vancouver from Kelowna to stay for the week to take a course .After the first night stay I got up in the morning and noticed I had a few bites on my chest. I thought they were ants or somthing. I went to my course and over that day I noticed swelling all over my arms and found about 25 bites.... very very itchy! Got back to the hotel (if you can call this dump a hotel) I spoke with front desk staff and showed him all my bites .Well he acted like he had never seen bed bug bites in his life.I wanted to change to another building but the front desk said no and put me in another room.So spent night 2 in a different room and woke up EATEN ALIVE in new room! I went to day 2 of my course bleeding and scratching. When I got back to hotel that night demanded my money back! Mgm told me no refund.So I left the dump and went to another hotel.Front desk staff was very rude, no money returned therefor you will never get me or anyone I know back as a customer! A WEEK LATER AND THE BLOODY BITES ARE JUST STARTING TO HEAL MAY LEAVE SCARRING!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: inga r
Reviews.Content: One night before the cruise was all we needed. Staff gave us room #229 . Room newly renovation. Although, It's an old hotel but you get what you pay for. Comfortable beds and tidy room. Close to Downtown, walking distance for restaurant ,Delightful staff . We would definitely stay here again. Great Budget Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, would highly reccomend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BikerNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We just returned home to North Carolina after visiting Vancouver to take an Alaskan Inland Waterway Cruise. I checked on line to find accomodations and fortunately found the City Centre Motor Hotel. It is probably one of the older hotels in the city but was a great location. The day desk clerk, Calvin, was very helpful in reccomending methods and locations to enjoy our stay. The accomodations are clean, well kept, the coffee is good, and the staff was great. The location was perfect as it is located on the bus line for easy access to the city. The neighborhood offerred good restaurants, bars, shopping and intersting shops. We will definately stay there again on any future trips. Thanks for your hospitality. Sterling & Eleanor Page

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on Main St”
Reviews.Author: anitacouch
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now and you cannot beat the price and location of this hotel. Staff are friendly, beds are new-ish and comfortable. You may not get all the amenities of a fancier hotel (shampoo, coffee maker) but for the price you cannot beat this hotel. They will give you a kettle and there's a coffee shop and great vegetarian restaurant next door. I totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bed hotel as explain”
Reviews.Author: davidvopravil
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am from Europe and I read a lot of comments to the hotel. I have to say it is not true. Hotel is two star hotel but servise and cleaness is in higher level. We had every day clean room and new towels. I was here during Olympic games but if you stay in standard time hotel rate is good.

Reviews.Title: “One up from the Cockroach Motel”
Reviews.Author: RoadRoller
Reviews.Content: The people here were curtious and knowledgeable of the area and provided service and etiquette typical of any hotel. The room I stayed in however was not quite up to par. I'm not picky when it comes to a room and bed after a very long drive, but when I notice grit build up in the hard to clean cracks of light switches that induces an urge to wash, something is wrong. The bed too was not in great condition with cigarette burns on all but the sheets. Overall, not a bad palce to stay and I did only visit one room and wittnessed some renovation happening. Oh, and pack a full size towel they don't provide one... only bar towels here!

Reviews.Title: “decent price and location but dirty and...”
Reviews.Author: pumpkin888
Reviews.Content: there were bed bugs in my room. I left after four days with about 20 very large red bumps on my neck, shoulders and arms! Also, I am certain the sheets were dirty when I checked in. There were some random people around, hooker screaming in the parking lot at 4am, that kind of stuff, but it wasn't TOO bad, although a female alone MAY feel unsafe. If you are on a really tight budget and without children it may suffice, but I'd recommened bringing your own linen and be on guard for bed bugs. The room itself had a shower and bath (although I wouldn't dare use the bath!), cable tv (60+ stations), heat/air con, desk/drawers, closet, phone with free local calls, wireless for $4/ day.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: travel416
Reviews.Content: I was to take a train from Vancouver to Seattle on the night of February 29th. The train got cancelled and I found out I wouldn't be leaving until the next morning. It was late at night, and rather then spend the night in the train station, I decided to take my chances at the nearest hotel, The City Centre Motor Hotel. After my harrowing experience there, I wish I had stayed at the train station. Right from the start the hotel had a very sketchy feel to it. There were hardly any lights on in the main office and there was an odd smell in the air. But I kept telling myself that it was better then a night at the station. When I got to my room I immediately showered. I kept trying to look past the mildew built up in the corners of the tub. After that I decided it was time to go to bed. So I lifted up the blankets and came upon a little black bug right in the middle of the bed. I then called down to the front desk and explained what I had found, and requested for my sheets to be changed. The clerk then told me that the sheets "usually" got cleaned, and there there "shouldn't" be any bugs in the bed. I didn't give up my insistance to get new sheets, and eventually he gave in and told me that since the cleaning staff had left for the night, all he could do was give me a new blanket if I came down and got it myself. I obliged and took the new comforter. It looked as if It was manufactured in the 1980s, it was old and ratty and had holes burned into it. While I was retrieving the new blanket, the clerk kept on trying to convince me there was nothing to worry about, that maybe I didn't really see a bug. I told him I had killed the bug and would gladly bring him down the paper with the bug on it as proof. So I came back and showed him the evidence. All he had to say after that was to tell me if I started to feel things crawling on me in the middle of the night, I would be able to get some more new sheets. What I ended up doing was putting the new burned comforter over top the old sheets, and laying on that to go to sleep. Then on my way out in the morning I noticed there were small bullet shaped indentations on the steel door. I also saw a dark stain in the hallway outside my room. I was just glad to be alive at that point. As a young woman traveling alone I did not feel safe or secure in this hotel, I don't think anyone in the right mind would. The room was appalling and the service I received was terrible. While the price was low, (only $70 for one night) it was not worth it. In the future I will pay any amount of money to not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A northerner”
Reviews.Author: niqirtsuituq
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 weeks in the hotel and although some of the 4 reports above describe extreme experiences, mine was not so bad. I choose it simply because it is convenient, I can walk anywhere and having to spend a total of 5 weeks in Vancouver, I could afford it, Vancouver price versus quality, I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Disgrace of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasLover
Reviews.Content: The City Centre Hotel gives you much less than what you pay for. We were vacationing from Texas and had just come up from our whale watching trip in Seattle. At about 11:00 p.m., we were just looking for a place to sleep and shower before leaving for breakfast and Grouse Mountain at around 7:00 a.m. The hotel we thought had plenty of rooms had sold out and we did not want to spend $180 plus tax for a sleep and shower hotel. The folks at Best Western reluctantly suggested that the City Centre Hotel was a few blocks down the street, but was for a different clientele than we may be comfortable with. With exhausted kids asleep in the backseat and a beautiful wife desperately needing some rest, we pulled into the hotel, which certainly had the look of a lower end motel. We were okay with that and knew that at this time of the year (late June), even low end motels could charge steep prices. At the window (the lobby was closed), the used car salesman like attendant told us that he had only one room left with two beds, so he would have to charge me $80 intead of $75 for the room. When I told him we had 2 kids, the price went up to $90 plus tax, for a total of $106 Canadian (about $95 U.S.) The attendant would not show me the room saying he was busy. The exhaustion I saw with my family helped me ignore my intuition and we bought the room for the night. To be fair, the air conditioner worked great and the hotel was reasonably quite. Free coffee was offered in the lobby in the morning. The water was still plenty hot after four long showers. The parking was free. The list of negatives, however, far outweighs the positives. The furniture was very worn and outdated. The beds were very thin and uncomfortable and looked like the type of mattresses you could haggle on at the local flea market. The thin and stained bedspreads had cigarette burns in them with one having about a two inch burn hole at the turndown section. The pillows were very flat and small. The 19" television was a 1980's model and was bolted down. The hotel offered basic cable channels. I was relieved to discover that there was no quarter slots that would make the beds go up and down and that there were no adult products sold in vending machines outside the hotel room. We do not know if we had an icebucket in our room and have no idea where the ice machine was located. My kids were particularly traumatized by looking at the stove in the mini kitchenette and seeing that the drip pans were thoroughly covered in a carbon black, burnt on crud. The kitchen sink had numerous and deep cracks in the enamel. The towels were anything but plush. They were very thin and scrathcy, having a kitchen towel type feel. The bathroom became a rainforest during our showers. No ventilation in the bathroom caused a great deal of condensation on the ceiling which dripped liberally onto the floor. In retrospect, I certainly wish I would have paid the extra $80, even for a very short hotel stay. The dirty, sub-par room was the worst part of our ten day vacation and is a disgrace to the beautiful City of Vancouver. One star is too high a rating for this hotel, which had our kids asking if hotels could be ranked with a negative star rating. We overpaid for this hotel room substantially at $106, but my review would still be the same if we got this room for $40. Do your family a favor, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This must have been one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at! After requesting a change of sheets (the ones on the bed smelled dirty), we got "fresh" sheets that smelled just as bad! The whole room was stinky, dirty and pretty disgusting. We left as soon as we could muster the energy, then drove home to Seattle to take a long shower to wash off the stink! I have been searching online for the Canadian Health Board, so I can report this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel late so had no option but to stay for one night. The room was dull, drab and dirty. It was so bad that we checked out at 5.30 a.m. without having even showered. I swear I was been bitten during the night.Definately not to be recommended.

HotelInfo.Name: City Centre Motor Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2111 Main Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V5T 3C6, Canada
